author: bridge-bot

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> and then i’ll see if i can do full block templates, but caveating i havent submitted a post mev-boost bundle before so may take some more time (if it’s the same as before mev-boost then i have all the code i need)

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> Nice progress @gakonst ! I'm working on some on-chain data analysis; to look into attestation performance etc. during bursts like this, compared to normal usage. Will share when I make progress there.

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> https://github.com/gakonst/stress4844, pretty simple as expected, good thing is it uses the rust infra so can extend it later to use proper blobs

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> i could make it spam faster by pre-signing and submitting everything at once

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> if the sub-second burst matters

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> although it seems to me that shouldn’t matter

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> i would think about edge cases around deserialization and big packet buffers breaking

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> vs ingress bandwidth etc becoming a problem

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> I’d look for CPU consumption on nodes, taht will be prob significant post 4844 due to the verification crypto

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> Anyway - LMK. Anyone should be able to run this, I’ll keep it running for a bunch of blocks later in the day, gonna be afk for couple hours

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> And will find a builder by EOD to run this with 512/1024kb (or if you have one that can whitelist my address 0xf5f02208279382cb8e6af943dafa8eac418bbdd3, pls lmk in private or here)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<terencechain> > <terencechain>  replying to: 
 ```@protolambda wrote: 
 Nice progress @gakonst ! I'm working on some on-chain data analysis; to look into attestation performance etc. during bursts like this, compared to normal usage...```
 feel free to dm if you need help modifying any part of prysm, I dont think client captures much info on attestation arrival latency. I started in this branch: https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/compare/2mb?expand=1

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> I would recommend going crazy with observability on everything

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> Ingress/Egress, CPU, Memory

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> I’m currently focused on onchain data, but can help with offchain metrics if you have ideas @terencechain

author: bridge-bot
content:
<terencechain> We should have most like ingress/engress, cpu, memory... etc
We just dont have metrics for attestation's arrival latency. Clients dont like to monitor individual attestations due to the increase of the cardinality of the DB. Tomorrow, I'll make sure my branch is ready for that

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> Awesome thx
